body: Leaders at the highest levels must make elimination a priority, especially as the malaria burden falls and other public health issues compete for resources and commitment. High-level political involvement is necessary to secure domestic funding, to ensure flexibility in programme decision-making and to demonstrate that the government is willing to do what it takes to ensure elimination and maintain it once it has been achieved. For subnational elimination, engagement with local political leaders is important. Verified malaria elimination should be of considerable interest for a provincial governor or a state prime minister in view of the benefits for the population and the health services, in addition to economic and political aspects.
title: 3.6.1 Political commitment
